ritmo.name: Pace
ritmo.desc: The rider's ability to maintain consistent lap times throughout the race. High pace allows better tire management and sustained concentration.

concentracion.name: Concentration
concentracion.desc: Ability to maintain focus throughout the race. High concentration reduces the probability of making costly errors that could affect the result.

frenada.name: Braking
frenada.desc: Skill to brake at the exact point consistently. Enables overtaking in braking zones and better control in tight corners.

aceleracion.name: Acceleration
aceleracion.desc: Ability to exit corners quickly and manage traction. Good acceleration makes the difference on circuits with many slow corners.

tecnica.name: Technique
tecnica.desc: Mastery of riding and ability to adapt to different conditions. Influences tire management and bike setup.

experiencia.name: Experience
experiencia.desc: Accumulated knowledge of circuits and race situations. Helps make better decisions under pressure and anticipate events.

motivacion.name: Motivation
motivacion.desc: Inner drive that elevates the rider's performance. High motivation improves all aspects of riding during the race.

recuperacion.name: Recovery
recuperacion.desc: Ability to recover fatigue between races. A rider with high recovery rests faster: up to 3% fatigue per hour with 99 attribute.

agresividad.name: Aggressiveness
agresividad.desc: Tendency to take risks in overtaking and defending positions. Can be advantageous but also increases the risk of incidents.

resistencia.name: Endurance
resistencia.desc: Ability to resist fatigue during races. A rider with high endurance accumulates less physical and mental wear during competition.

talento.name: Talent
talento.desc: Innate ability to excel in critical situations. Talent manifests in the first corner, decisive overtakes, and adverse conditions like rain.

edad.name: Age
edad.desc: The rider's age influences their experience and recovery capacity. Young riders have more improvement potential, while veterans bring experience.

estaturaInfo.name: Height
estaturaInfo.desc: Height affects top speed and stability. Shorter riders have better aerodynamics, while taller ones have more stability.

pesoInfo.name: Weight
pesoInfo.desc: Weight influences acceleration, braking, and control. An optimal weight (65-75kg) balances all advantages without significant penalties.

envergaduraInfo.name: Wingspan
envergaduraInfo.desc: Arm span affects corner control and arm fatigue. Greater wingspan improves control but may increase tiredness.
